Comment: Adjectives and a limited number of participles (resultative, subject & future participles) are categorized into this section. See Dum-Tragut(2009) for more discussion.
Adjectives are rigidly preposed to the noun. An exception to this rigid rule can only be found in poetic language (Dum-Tragut: 2009, p. 586).
Definite enclitic immediately follows the noun while the optional indefinite marker mi immediately precedes the noun.
Relative clauses obligatorily follow their head noun (Dum-Tragut: 2009).
stylistically marked (poetic) and information-structurally marked (contrastive focus)
A noun-phrase may contain more than one adjective and naturally also more than one semantic type of adjective (Dum-Tragut: 2009, p.586).
